contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Journal | title = Xenobiotica | cover = [[File:Xenobiotica cover image.jpg|150px]] | editor = Costas Ioannides | discipline = [[Pharmacology]], [[toxicology]] | abbreviation = Xenobiotica | publisher = [[Informa]] | country = [[United Kingdom]] | frequency = Monthly | history = 1971-present | openaccess = | license = | impact = 1.791 | impact-year = 2011 | website = http://informahealthcare.com/loi/xen | link1 = | link1-name = | link2 = | link2-name = | RSS = http://www.informapharmascience.com/action/showFeed?ui=0&mi=3b4d5z&ai=98p&jc=xen&type=etoc&feed=rss | atom = | JSTOR = | OCLC = 01588798 | LCCN = 75616763 | CODEN = XENOBH | ISSN = 0049-8254 | eISSN = 1366-5928 }} '''''Xenobiotica''''' is a [[Peer review|peer-reviewed]] [[medical journal]] that publishes comprehensive research papers on all areas of [[xenobiotic]]s. It is published by [[Informa|Informa plc]] and covers six main areas: * ''General Xenobiochemistry'', including [[in vitro]] studies concerned with the [[metabolism]], disposition and excretion of drugs, and other xenobiotics, as well as the structure, function and regulation of associated enzymes * ''Clinical [[Pharmacokinetics]] and Metabolism'', covering the [[pharmacokinetics]] and absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of drugs and other [[xenobiotic]]s in man. * ''Animal [[Pharmacokinetics]] and [[Metabolism]]'', covering the pharmacokinetics, and absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of drugs and other xenobiotics in animals. * ''Pharmacogenetics'', defined as the identification and functional characterisation of polymorphic genes that encode xenobiotic metabolising enzymes and transporters that may result in altered enzymatic, cellular and clinical responses to xenobiotics. * ''Molecular Toxicology'', concerning the mechanisms of toxicity and the study of [[toxicology]] of xenobiotics at the molecular level. * ''Topics in Xenobiochemistry'', in the form of reviews and commentaries are primarily intended to be a critical analysis of the issue, wherein the author offers opinions on the relevance of data or of a particular experimental approach or methodology. According to the ''[[Journal Citation Reports]]'', the journal received a 2011 [[impact factor]] of 1.791, ranking it 157th out of 261 journals in the category ''Pharmacology & Pharmacy''<ref name=WoS>{{cite book |year=2012 |chapter=Journals Ranked by Impact: Pharmacology & Pharmacy |title=2011 [[Journal Citation Reports]] |publisher=[[Thomson Reuters]] |edition= Sciences |accessdate=2013-03-10 |series=Web of Science |postscript=.}}</ref> and 58th out of 83 journals in the category ''Toxicology''.<ref name=WoS1>{{cite book |year=2012 |chapter=Journals Ranked by Impact: Toxicology |title=2011 [[Journal Citation Reports]] |publisher=[[Thomson Reuters]] |edition= Sciences |accessdate=2013-03-10 |series=Web of Science |postscript=.}}</ref> The [[editor in chief]] is Costas Ioannides ([[University of Surrey]]).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.surrey.ac.uk/SBMS/ACADEMICS_homepage/ioannides/ |title= Costas Ioannides Homepage |accessdate=2009-03-16 |format= |work=surrey.ac.uk }}</ref> == Abstracting and indexing == ''Xenobiotica'' is abstracted and indexed in [[Biochemistry and Biophysics Citation Index]], [[BIOSIS]], [[Chemical Abstracts Service|Chemical Abstracts]]; [[Current Contents]]/Life Science, [[EBSCO Industries|EBSCO]], [[Science Citation Index]], [[PASCAL (database)|PASCAL]], [[SciSearch]], [[Scopus]], and [[Index Medicus]]/[[MEDLINE]]/[[PubMed]]. == References == {{reflist|2}} == External links == * {{Official|http://informahealthcare.com/loi/xen}} [[Category:Publications established in 1971]] [[Category:Pharmacology journals]] [[Category:Toxicology journals]] [[Category:Informa academic journals]] [[Category:Monthly journals]] [[Category:English-language journals]]
